One more question: Does anyone know what does the Pid slot for the pid controller mean.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-02-20T12:55:20.695Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":158,"readers_count":157,"score":76.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":427438,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-pid-controller","display_username":"Ryan zheng","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":31620,"username":"khope","name":"khope","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/f6c823/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55168,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-pid-controller/427438/4","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3149026,"name":"khope","username":"khope","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/f6c823/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-20T13:24:17.913Z","cooked":"

A controller can have multiple sets of pid settings. So you can store multiple sets of pid values into a controller at the same time and switch between them. Each set is stored in a different “slot”. We’ve never needed to use more than one slot so we always use slot 0. But if your controller needed to have different pid values based on what it was doing at the time, you could add them in and just pick which one you wanted to use when it was time. I’m not even sure of a good example since we’ve never done it, but maybe if you needed to have your controller do both a position PID and a Velocity PID at different times, maybe you’d have different pid values for each and you could store them separately.

Hmmm…never knew I could do that.

Here’s a case that I might try tomorrow night. The appropriate Feed Forward value might be different for different arm positions. I’ve been changing it during operation, but I could use a different slot instead.

In general, if using PID for arm control, the best values might be different for position control at multiple positions. Slots might make that programming simpler.
